figures.caption: This is Figure A.
figures.detail: At the lower left of the painting, two men hoist the body of another man -- not a flood victim, but John Daniels, a young African American community activist.

figures.caption: John Daniels (Diver)
figures.detail: "Floating above is the upside-down body of a diver, his back gracefully arching but still suggesting the velocity of his fall."

figures.caption: John Daniels
figures.detail: "He [Daniels] became PSU's junior class president and, later, a teacher who committed suicide."

figures.caption: Scarf
figures.detail: The body is adorned with a scarf patterned in an African motif, a symbol of honor.

figures.caption: 290 Broadacres
figures.detail: The most explicit reference to Vanport is an address once found in the town: 290 Broadacres.

figures.caption: Totem Pole
figures.detail: A totem pole rises up the left side, an autobiographical reference to Native American cultures the artist encountered as he grew up here.
